column2: $ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Civil War to Remove The King's Peace
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to remove internal peace!
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Civil War to Remove Title Revocation
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to remove title revocation!
$ORDER$$SECOND_ADJ$ Civil War to Remove Protected Inheritance
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to remove protected inheritance in the §Y$TITLE$§!
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to reduce obligations!
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can declare war to retake the Anatolian coast.
With the world shattered by mysterious forces it is ripe for the taking. Might shall make right.
With the world shattered by mysterious forces it is ripe for the taking. Might shall make right.
With the world shattered by mysterious forces it is ripe for the taking. Might shall make right.
This Casus Belli can be used by §Y$CLAIMANT$§! to press the claim on the §Y$TITLE$§!

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can use this Casus Belli to seize all titles held by the infidel, §Y$TARGET$§!, within the de jure §Y$TITLE$§!. You get this CB thanks to the target having provinces of your religion within it. It will always conquer the target duchy outright.

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can use this Casus Belli to seize all titles held by the infidel, §Y$TARGET$§!, within the de jure §Y$TITLE$§!. You get this CB due to playing as either Jerusalem or a Holy Order, letting you bypass nearly all regular holy war requirements. This CB outright conquers the target, while the regular Holy War CB will only vassalize.
